intro: Gilia gracilis subsp. eugracilis, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves are characteristic features of the subspecies. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
